Located in the last floor of a renovated 18th century house with a balcony to the picturesque Rua do Pinheiro. This sunny studio has 35 sq./m, including WC and an all equipped kitchen. One double bed and one extra single bed, by demand.

neighborhood_overview: Rua do Pinheiro is located in a vivid neighborhood with antique dealers, second - hand bookshops and charming pubs. 5 min walking to Trindade Metro Station Terminal, 3 min to the City Hall, 10 min to the riverside.
host_about:
Casa do Pinheiro was a typical 18th century building in the city centre, normally for big families, and was recently bought by Bernardo and Francisca Amaral ( brothers) and rehabillitated for 4 different apartments. They live on two of them and the Studio and Duplex facing the street are destined to receive travellers and short term inhabitants. The rehabilitation project, conceived and directed by Bernardo, a free-lance architect, has been recently recognised with an honourable mention in a rehabilitation prize, promoted by the city council._x000D_
We both, live in Porto, in the city centre, for more than ten years, and always propose our new guest our own view on the city life, it's hidden spots and paths, restaurants, cafes, a good place to eat fish or hear some fado. Francisca is a tour guide. Bernardo also organizes walking and driven tours, focused on the  architecture of Oporto School, but also on the city's urban development since the 12th century._x000D_

name: Rental unit in Porto Â· â˜…4.77 Â· 1 bedroom Â· 2 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
The space
Located in the first and second floors of a renovated 18th century house with a balcony to the picturesque Rua do Pinheiro. This duplex apartment has 70 sq./m, including WC and an all equipped kitchen. The sleeping room has a beautiful stucco in the ceiling and double bed, with enough space for one or two extra beds. The living room in the first floor has a balcony over the street. One sofa with double bed is also part of this living/sleeping room.

Rua do Pinheiro is located in a vivid neighborhood with antique dealers, second - hand bookshops and charming pubs. 5 min walking to Trindade Metro Station Terminal, 3 min to the City Hall, 10 min to the riverside.

License number
6184/AL
host_about:
Casa do Pinheiro was a typical 18th century building in the city centre, normally for big families, and was recently bought by Bernardo and Francisca Amaral ( brothers) and rehabillitated for 4 different apartments. They live on two of them and the Studio and Duplex facing the street are destined to receive travellers and short term inhabitants. The rehabilitation project, conceived and directed by Bernardo, a free-lance architect, has been recently recognised with an honourable mention in a rehabilitation prize, promoted by the city council._x000D_
We both, live in Porto, in the city centre, for more than ten years, and always propose our new guest our own view on the city life, it's hidden spots and paths, restaurants, cafes, a good place to eat fish or hear some fado. Francisca is a tour guide. Bernardo also organizes walking and driven tours, focused on the  architecture of Oporto School, but also on the city's urban development since the 12th century._x000D_

neighborhood_overview:
The location is amazing combines sea, beach, countryside, nature and city lifestyle (OPO / Gaia / Espinho). Youâ€™ll find everything to make your vacation a memorable ones!

This eclectic Penthouse Ap is located in an unbelievable place, overlooks ocean Atlantic and just in front of Madalena Beach which is very quiet, safe and a pleasant place.

You are 10 min. by car from Oporto city, 1 min walk away of pedestrian promenade, cycle tracks and surrounded of some of the most splendid beaches of Porto city.

The coastline of Gaia has 32 oceanic beaches (Naturism is very common in Cabedelo beach / Douro Beach).

The local large sandy beach, with some rocky areas and calm sea, is complemented by wooden walkways which are attractive options for biking or long promenades.

Unforgettable experiences for you and your family members:
* Nature, Romantic sunsets, Maritime landscapes
* Several Blue flag beaches, promenade, wooden footpath
host_about:
Born in Oporto / Porto, I love my city but not only. I love to travel around the world for studies or for leisure. For me to travel/discover new landscapes and new cultures are one of the most important things in life. As IÂ´m used to be in different parts of the world, I appreciate a fantastic place to stay as much as you do! _x000D_
_x000D_
I decided to rent my fabulous Beachfront apartment because I think it has luxury conditions for visitors and I like to meet people from other countries. My renters are always delighted with the property and I enjoy seeing their faces as they come into the apartment and see the high standards in quality & style for their holiday. _x000D_
_x000D_
I love the place I live in, because it is calm, unbeatable, just by the seaside and for its accessibility to Oporto / Porto. Porto is close to it too (about 30 minutes away by bus from Porto and just 1 minute walk to bus stop). _x000D_
_x000D_
I love to arrive home after a long day's work in Porto / Oporto and in the minute I set foot in the entrance hall having Beach and Ocean views. The facilities on the site and the local facilities are more than you can expect with plenty to see, eat and drink. I love it: play a party of squash, swimming, walk on the beach, cycling, go to the beach bars..._x000D_
_x000D_
It's important to me that renters can relax and enjoy the luxurious comforts of this Beachfront Penthouse whilst sampling the delights of all that Oporto / Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia has to offer. I am very happy to help in anyway, either before, or when you arrive. Just let me know what I can do to make your trip a good one!_x000D_

neighborhood_overview:
PraÃ§a de Gomes Teixeira, The Square with the fountain of Lions

This might be one of the nicest squares in the Carmo district of Porto. The square with the fountain of lions.
It got its name on 1936 in honor of Francisco Gomes Teixeira, a well known professor in the University of Porto.
Around the square there are some buildings belong to the university, the Carmo Church and main roads to the city center.
It is a walking distance from Sao Bento station, Livreria Lello and the beautiful Rua Galeria de Paris.
The fountain with lions around it, is one of the few water sources in the city.
Highly recommended to visit this beautiful square and peek into the university store or paying a visit inside the beautiful church.
This charming apartment, totally renewed, is located in Oporto's historical center, (classsified by UNESCO as World Heritage Site) in the middle of the bar and restaurant distrit, near Torre dos ClÃ©rigos, a very busy part of Town.

neighborhood_overview:
THE NEIGHBOURHOOD:

The area is known as the ARTS DISTRICT and the house is located at the epicentre of the art scene and near the famous Oporto nightlife, so you'll have pretty much everything at a walking distance:

Art galleries, illustration galleries, design stores, vintage stores, old books and comics stores, record stores, all kind of restaurants (typical, vegetarian, gourmet, all price ranges), tea and coffee shops, supermarkets, bio stores, bars, clubs and night-life, car parking, bus stops, pharmacies and many other services: all around our street and neighbourhood.

host_about:
We are your hosts at Casa da Paz!_x000D_
_x000D_
Gabriela Molinos was born in Porto and has been working in the 5-star hotel industry over the past 15 years. Passionate about travelling and totally in love with Porto and Portugal, she can combine luxury and vacation rentals like no other._x000D_
Â _x000D_
Tiago Molinos was also born in Porto, but grew up in Caminha. Heâ€™s our Geek! Heâ€™s a specialist in wireless and networking.  And a true enthusiast of water sports and motorbikes._x000D_

We are the family in charge of making your stay in Porto better than you imagined._x000D_

We hope you enjoy the house as much as we do.

name: Home in Vila Nova de Gaia Â· â˜…4.68 Â· 2 bedrooms Â· 2 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
Casa do Mestrinho is a licensed holiday home two hundred years old house with garden is set near the river Douro, in Avintes (Vila Nova de Gaia), 8km from Porto.
This is the perfect place to stay if you want to explore the beautiful city of Porto while simultaneously recharging your batteries!

The space
Nineteenth century house, charming, recently refurbished and fully furnished house, ideal for people looking for a temporary rental. This is an ecological house with regard to the techniques used in its restoration, and also because we reused old furniture. Along side with this, we created conditions for the separation and recycling of garbage, specially the one required to make homemade compost.
What makes this unique? You can visit the city (Oporto, but also GuimarÃ¢es, Braga, Vila do Conde, Viana do Castelo) and, when returning home, eat and sleep like if you were in the field. You may also decide to do nothing, just sunbathing in the garden, reading
neighborhood_overview:
The place, called EspinhaÃ§o, was habited at least since the eighteenth century, mostly by fishermen. It is an ancient village with narrow, winding streets. Today it is a place of good-natured simple people.
Located in a peaceful, and extremely beautiful semi-rural area, 100 meters away from the Douro river. You can take nice walks along the river, have your meals in the garden under the shade of vines and have a good night sleep in a very quiet place.
In the village of avintes we highlighted as the main landmark the Gaia Biological Park, interesting project of nature conservation.
Located only 9Km from Porto center, near the main highways that connect the north and south of the country and 27km from Porto's Airport. Nearby there is public transport but with very limited schedules. A car is required.
What makes this unique? You can visit the city (not only Oporto, the closest one, but also GuimarÃ¢es, Braga, Vila do Conde, Viana do Castelo) and, when returning home,

Oporto Home Boutique Apartments â€“ River Front is comprised of 6 tourist apartments, all located in the same building, fully equipped so that our guests can fully enjoy their leisure or business stay. The building dates from the 18th century and is classified as part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. With two windows in the bedroom and two balconies facing the river in the living room, this apartment provides you with unique views of Rio

host_about:
Oporto Home Boutique Apartments are a touristic apartments chain developed by portuguese entrepreneurs that have more than 10 years of existence.  We believe that the more globalised and standardised the world becomes, the more people want to experience something authentic when they travel. Whether our guests are stopping off for a few hours or a few days, for work or for pleasure, we want to pass them the feeling and soul of a genuine Porto. We strive daily to make our guests feel welcomed, comfortable, locals, at home.

Self contained large remodeled studio flat near CASA DA MUSICA / BOAVISTA, on the 4th and last floor (with elevator, obviously! ), comprises large sunny lounge / room, large bathroom with italian shower, large sunny fully equipped kitchen (including fridge, micro-wave oven, vitro ceramic stove, toaster and coffee machine). Charming recent double bedroom apartment, combining a stunning river view with a central location in the old district! 5m walking from Cathedral, Luis I iron bridge, Ribeira panoramic elevator, Batalha Square, Sta. Catarina street and Majestic caffÃ©!

The space
The Apartment:

Double room apartment located on the 2nd floor with elevator of a modern and recently built condo (2010), right in the city center, fully equipped and with surely the Best river view in town!
Picturesquely situated in a cliff at one of the oldest districts of Porto (the Fontainhas district) it will make you feel almost as if you were standing in a natural balcony overviewing the Douro river!

The Equippment:

The apartment has all the facilities for a short stay, and the comfort for a longer family holiday such as:
- Red Room (one double bed 160x220cm)
- Blue Room (three single beds 90x200cm each)
- Living room with large sofa confortable f
neighborhood_overview:
Holiday Festivities:

In June on the night from 23rd to 24th, the hole city celebrates its religious patron day, St.John (S.JoÃ£o).
Traditionally, people come out in the street to watch the firewoks show in the river by the iron bridge and then walk the city up and down dancing in the various street parties.
The Fontainhas district has an eternal connection to theses festivities and this is usually the place where people pass by during their night march!
It is crowded to say the least! This is one of the night you should stay at this apartment!
host_about:
I am 36 years old and lucky to
own a very nice apartment in the Unesco World Heritage, in Oporto and would be very pleased to host you during your stay in this magnificent city!
I am interested in travelling, sports and history.
Portuguese food is my favourite and it will surely be yours too once you taste it. The mix of flavours is just unbelievable and not to mention the amazing fish on our coast!
I usually enjoy travelling backpack so my favourite trips are of course, interrail style!
My apartment is very cozy and modern, besides its very central location, wich will allow you to walk any interest point!
Portugal is an undescovered treasure. Where else can you have breakfast in World Heritage spot, have lunch by the beach and dinner in the mountains in just one day?
Do not think twice, come and visit Oporto and Portugal!
Cheers!

name: Rental unit in Porto Â· â˜…4.68 Â· 1 bedroom Â· 2 beds Â· 2 baths
description:
This apartment is located in the old Jewish quarter called Olival, a very interesting neighbourhood from a historical viewpoint. The building was built at the beginning of the 19th century and, over the years, has been renovated with all modern amenities, while keeping the original character.
This is a vey typical neighbourhood. You will meet the locals, the most picturesque people in town; they are very welcoming and joyous and fill the streets with their typical language and sincere generosity.
Wander through the narrow streets and steep stairways in this area, have lunch in the restaurant â€œCaraÃ§asâ€ (cheap and very typical) and visit the renovated cafÃ©s and shops in town. If you like walking, go down the narrow streets which you lead you to the river, hire a bike and cycle down to the seafront, where you will find wonderful beaches and esplanades for all tastes.
This apartment is on the first floor, has a patio at the back and is extremely comfortable and quiet.
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located on a quiet street in the Jewish Quarter, where you'll find fascinating history at every turn. The neighbourhood's cobblestoned streets are lined with typical Portuguese taverns and cafes, perfect for whiling away the afternoon.
There are parking restrictions nearby: please ask for detailed information.
host_about:
My name is LÃ­gia, I work by my own as an engineering geologist, with lots of work done in Porto and some around the world. Together with my sister LUISA I manage our short rental business.
Our values are: sustainability; ambition; entrepreneurial spirit; equality and respect, and last but not least, passion for what we do. 
At the end all we win!!

Open French doors to a Juliet balcony and admire views across red-tiled rooftops of a historic neighborhood and into the horizon. It's charming and inviting inside, with gleaming timber floors spanning from the bedrooms to a light-filled living area.
This is one of our 6 apartments, take a look to the others and choose what suits you better

The space
The apartment is on the 4th floor of a centenary building that over the years, has been renovated with all modern amenities, while keeping the original character. The building doesn't have lift.
The views are breathtaking; from here you see the roofs of the historic center, the Douro River and boats, far away, the smooth hillside of Vila Nova de Gaia city, and more close, the Vitoria church.
The apartment is preppared to receive 6 guests and have all the amenities: cooker, washing machine, microwave, coffee maker and kettle.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in a neighborhood of narrow streets, with the beautiful viewpoint of VitÃ³ria. It's a noble area where, in the 16th century, the population of Porto housed the Jews persecuted by King Manuel I.
Here you will meet the locals, the most picturesque people in town; they are very welcoming and joyous and fill the streets with their typical language and sincere generosity.
Wander through the narrow streets and steep stairways in this area, have lunch in the restaurant â€œCaraÃ§asâ€ (cheap and very typical) and visit the renovated cafÃ©s and shops in town. If you like walking, go down the narrow streets which you lead you to the river, hire a bike and cycle down to the seafront, where you will find wonderful beaches and esplanades for all tastes.
The neighborhoods are safety and quit. Here you are close to everything: 5 minute walk from the main bus stops and 10 minutes away from the metro; it is very near to the hectic nightlife of the city, where music is everyw

name: Villa in Maia Â· â˜…4.75 Â· 3 bedrooms Â· 5 beds Â· 2.5 baths
description:
The house is perfect! Magnificent garden with fruit trees, ponds, patios, and a 12-meter long covered swimming pool, excellent for an early morning swim. Train to Porto at 5 min, a shopping center at 5 min and a bakery nearby. Very well equipped, with a fully functional laundry room, pool stretchers, including beach towels, fully equipped kitchen and bathrooms! There are also two bicycles for your rides and a vintage table football (foosball) for frenzied games and great laughs!

The space
I'm renting out an amazing stone house dating back to 1740, just 15km away from Porto. It's a great place to spend some relaxing holidays in the countryside.

The house has 2 bedrooms, one with a double bed and the other with two single beds. Both rooms have a bathroom and there's also a third guest WC. The kitchen is fully equipped (including a stove, fridge, microwave oven, dishwasher and a table). There's also a washing machine, an iron and an ironing board in the

host_about:
Hi, my name is Elisa and I'm renting out a beautiful stone house near Porto. It's not just a house, it's a real home and it's been in my family for several generations! It's recently vacant and I'd like to open the doors to travelers from all over the world. I want it to be your home when you come to visit Porto and I will do my best to make you feel comfortable. _x000D_
_x000D_
Please feel free to reach out to me with any questions, I'm happy to meet your needs if you need an extra bed or any tips and advice. I speak Portuguese and French and, with the help of my 2 sons, we can also communicate in English, Spanish, and German. If I'm able to, I'd love to come and fetch you in the airport and I'd be happy to share a meal with you if you'd enjoy that._x000D_
_x000D_
Looking forward to welcoming you in Portugal!

neighborhood_overview:
Matosinhos (a fisherman's city) is renowned for its gastronomy, especially the fresh fish. By lunch or dinner time, you start thinking about the old quarters in Matosinhos or LeÃ§a da Palmeira, caressed by the fine odors coming out, either from fine restaurant kitchens or from simple charcoal grills on the street, where fish and seafood are cooked. It is an irresistible calling to our senses that you will satisfy in exquisite restaurants or in simple and informal taverns. In Matosinhos eating is, for everybody, a motto for quality and excellence.

Even though meat isn't forgotten (old recipes are still in use: stewed, roasted, boiled, with vegetables, potatoes, beans; or with new recipes), fish has become a special attraction, for its variety, freshness, and quality, explained by the nearness of the sea and the fish market.

Very close to the apartment there's the Matosinhos beach (200 meters), with a very well-known surfer's spot. The Supermarket is just at 250

Welcome to our self-catered apartments!
 
Located on the historical center of Oporto, in the heart of a UNESCO World Heritage Center, you'll find a building that belongs to our family for four generations.
 
After my mother (Lu'is grandmother) passed away in 2010 I inherited this building and found a really degraded space with a lot of structural problems and fierce tenants.
 
Having one apartment vacant me and my sons decided to refurbish the entire apartment and prepare it with all the needed amenities for a modern and cozy experience.
 
And we decided to rent it for tourists.
 
The first of our apartments came to daylight in May 2012. Our yellow apartment.
 
The experience was so overwhelming with massive bookings and great reviews that we decided to "tackle" the rest of the building.
 
And so we did.
 
In October 2012 the building went to major refurbishment works with all the structural, electricity, plumbing and communications being changed.
 
We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

host_about:
Hi, I'm Rui 40 years old and me and Joana are from Porto.
We love socialising with friends and meeting new people
Joana and Me are polite and friendly. We also understand what it's like to have visitors staying in our Touristic house, so we know how to behave when we're the guests! 
We are passionate about the world, We love traveling, experiencing other cultures and walk everywhere. I also volunteer at the Portuguese Institute of Oncology in the host service to the patient, very rewarding for me. 
Work in a textile company but got this House and Guests itÂ´s really a pleasure.
We love to learn about new things, people and cultures. 
One of our favourite meals is a Northern Portuguese dish called Francesinha. It's a heart attack on a plate, but it's delicious! Best come to Porto and experience it for yourself.  
I hope to please all my guests so that they feel good with every comfort.

host_about:
Mother and Son in Porto, Portugal - improving the art of hospitality

Welcome to our self-catered apartments!
 
Located on the historical center of Oporto, in the heart of a UNESCO World Heritage Center, you'll find a building that belongs to our family for four generations.
 
After my mother (Lu'is grandmother) passed away in 2010 I inherited this building and found a really degraded space with a lot of structural problems and fierce tenants.
 
Having one apartment vacant me and my sons decided to refurbish the entire apartment and prepare it with all the needed amenities for a modern and cozy experience.
 
And we decided to rent it for tourists.
 
The first of our apartments came to daylight in May 2012. Our yellow apartment.
 
The experience was so overwhelming with massive bookings and great reviews that we decided to "tackle" the rest of the building.
 
And so we did.
 
In October 2012 the building went to major refurbishment works with all the structural, electricity, plumbing and communications being changed.
 
We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

neighborhood_overview:
Once a former home to Jewish and Armenian communities, its colorful old houses, cobbled streets, and location near the river will charm anyone who visits Miragaia. This area is also known for being particularly lively during SÃ£o JoÃ£o, the traditional street party that takes place in Porto in June.

Moreover, Miragaia is where you can eat sardines and drink the best of Portuguese wine as you watch the sunset over the river. Donâ€™t forget to take a walk alongside the Douro. You will not miss the Ponte LuÃ­s I, a spectacular metal arch bridge that spans the river between Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia.

You will see that the Bolsa Palace dominates the Infante D. Henrique Square. Visit the famous Arab room inspired by the Alhambra of Grenada in Spain. Igreja de San Francisco is must visit if you want to be refresh!

After, you can either hop on the Funicular dos Guindais or stroll along Bandeirinha da SaÃºde (Miradouro) to get a better view of the Douro river

description:
Newly refurbished apartment providing wifi, tv cable, cozy, modern & relaxed atmosphere. Guaranteed to be an unforgettable travelling experience providing a unique riverfront view of the Rabelo boats navigating the river Douro and Port Wine Cellars.

The space
The Rabelo boat is a traditional Portuguese boat, which for centuries held the job of transporting people and goods along the river Douro. It is native of the Douro region, it exists nowhere else in the world. Its history is closely linked to the production and trade of Port Wine. Although no longer in use, we can still admire these graceful vessels belonging to Port Wine Companies on the banks of the River Douro, in the cities of Porto and Gaia.

The apartment is at the heart of the historic center of Porto between the monumental Customs Congress Center and the Ribeira area that is declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Rabelo apartment is a 2Âº floor, one bedroom apartment newly refurbished pr
neighborhood_overview:
Miragaia is a colourful neighbourhood built near the Douro River. This medieval neighbourhood was built on the beach during the Discoveries Era. Nowadays the colourful quirky houses built over arches give the neighbourhood its personality. Miragaia is the place to be to truly experience the city, filled with both locals and tourists.
As the sun goes down, Miragaiaâ€™s restaurants and bars open. Here you can quietly have dinner or enjoy a drink with some friends while enjoying the beautiful views of the river and of the rest of the city

Surrounded by cafes and shops that make this area one of the main tourist areas of the city, everything is accessible within a short walk to the main tourist attractions of the city located within a 15 minute walk, the Church of San Francisco, SÃ£o Bento Station, Avenue of the Allies, Porto Cathedral, etc..,

Porto is well known for its inhabitants and the warm way they welcome all visitors to the city.
Adding a local touch to a wonderful and unforgettable stay.
Walking through these streets is the best way to see the hidden and beautiful spots of the city, meet the locals and enjoy fado and Portuguese cuisine in the most wonderful and unexpected places.
A walk along the river is even more recommended in this location.

host_about:
Mother and Son in Porto, Portugal - improving the art of hospitality

Welcome to our self-catered apartments!
 
Located on the historical center of Oporto, in the heart of a UNESCO World Heritage Center, you'll find a building that belongs to our family for four generations.
 
After my mother (Lu'is grandmother) passed away in 2010 I inherited this building and found a really degraded space with a lot of structural problems and fierce tenants.
 
Having one apartment vacant me and my sons decided to refurbish the entire apartment and prepare it with all the needed amenities for a modern and cozy experience.
 
And we decided to rent it for tourists.
 
The first of our apartments came to daylight in May 2012. Our yellow apartment.
 
The experience was so overwhelming with massive bookings and great reviews that we decided to "tackle" the rest of the building.
 
And so we did.
 
In October 2012 the building went to major refurbishment works with all the structural, electricity, plumbing and communications being changed.
 
We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

host_about:
Hey!
My name is Raul and I live in Porto.
I like to walk outdoors, have a beer with my friends and I love "Francesinhas" (you will know what this is when in town).

I love to travel and I am fortunate to do most trips with my longtime girlfriend/wife. Together, we have been to more than 25 countries and are always looking for the next destination. 
We have 2 children (a girl born in 2016 and a boy born in 2020), so now we have more stuff to carry on trips. :)

I will be very happy to be your host in Porto!

The apartments are decorated with the Cinema theme and have all the commodities needed for a memorable stay.

The apartments are decorated with the Cinema theme and you can choose T
host_about:
Rivoli Cinema Hostel is the first Cinema themed Hostel in Portugal, and here you can find 13 rooms each one about a different film.You can choose a room by a Director or by a Film, and the interior of the room is decorated with things about the film. You can find movies from Tim Burton, Tarantino, Ridley Scott, Almodovar, Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Godard, Manoel de Oliveira, David Fincher, Alejandro GonzÃ¡lez IÃ±Ã¡rritu, Michael Radford, Mira Nair, Steven Spielberg, Stanley Kubrick, Jonathan Demme, Ang Lee._x000D_
_x000D_
The Rivoli Cinema Hostel has 12 rooms available (twin or double beds and 4 beds room), 6 shared toilets and 6 shared showers, a fully equipped kitchen, 1 lounge area where you can relax, have a drink, read books and play games, and an outside 180 m2 space where you can listen to music, barbecue, sunbath, party, or just chat with the others guests._x000D_
_x000D_
In the Hostel you can use free WiFi internet, and you have free maps, tourist info and guides._x000D_
Rivoli Cinema Hostel is located in the Porto historical center, right at the most important city square:  Avenida dos Aliados- where you can find streets full of monuments, restaurants, cafes, esplanades, shops, supermarkets, shoppings, tourism info spots . RCH is right in center of the cultural center of Porto near Coliseu, Cinemas, Theaters, and Art Galleries._x000D_
_x000D_
At the doorstep you can find metro, bus, sightseeing bus, train, taxis and tram.From here you can easily visit the most important references in the city like the Port Wine Cellars, Clerigos Tower, Serralves Museum and its beautiful gardens, go to a concert in Casa da Musica, take a walk across the bridges, take a look at a local architecture, visit the F. C. Porto stadium, travel by boat in Douro river where you can take great pictures and have a drink in one of the many bars in Ribeira._x000D_
_x000D_
Nightlife is around the hostel, you just have to choose between cafes, nightclubs, discos or bars where you can meet Erasmus students and locals. Right across the street you have the Rivoli Theater where you can see musicals and at February you can attend one of the best Fantastic Cinema Festival in the world â€“ Fantasporto.

host_about:
Mother and Son in Porto, Portugal - improving the art of hospitality

Welcome to our self-catered apartments!
 
Located on the historical center of Oporto, in the heart of a UNESCO World Heritage Center, you'll find a building that belongs to our family for four generations.
 
After my mother (Lu'is grandmother) passed away in 2010 I inherited this building and found a really degraded space with a lot of structural problems and fierce tenants.
 
Having one apartment vacant me and my sons decided to refurbish the entire apartment and prepare it with all the needed amenities for a modern and cozy experience.
 
And we decided to rent it for tourists.
 
The first of our apartments came to daylight in May 2012. Our yellow apartment.
 
The experience was so overwhelming with massive bookings and great reviews that we decided to "tackle" the rest of the building.
 
And so we did.
 
In October 2012 the building went to major refurbishment works with all the structural, electricity, plumbing and communications being changed.
 
We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

host_about:
Mother and Son in Porto, Portugal - improving the art of hospitality

Welcome to our self-catered apartments!
 
Located on the historical center of Oporto, in the heart of a UNESCO World Heritage Center, you'll find a building that belongs to our family for four generations.
 
After my mother (Lu'is grandmother) passed away in 2010 I inherited this building and found a really degraded space with a lot of structural problems and fierce tenants.
 
Having one apartment vacant me and my sons decided to refurbish the entire apartment and prepare it with all the needed amenities for a modern and cozy experience.
 
And we decided to rent it for tourists.
 
The first of our apartments came to daylight in May 2012. Our yellow apartment.
 
The experience was so overwhelming with massive bookings and great reviews that we decided to "tackle" the rest of the building.
 
And so we did.
 
In October 2012 the building went to major refurbishment works with all the structural, electricity, plumbing and communications being changed.
 
We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

name: Condo in Porto Â· â˜…4.76 Â· 3 bedrooms Â· 3 beds Â· 1 bath
description:
Open space apartment with breathtaking sea view of Foz, one of the most hi-level areas of the city. The word "Foz" means river mouth. You are only 10m walk where the Douro river meets the Atlantic ocean with beautiful beaches with vibrant bars or you can take the old tram that goes along the river to the heart of the city. Bus stop to city centre just 100m away.

The space
The apartment is for 4 persons. It has a garden for private condo use with a playground for children. Kitchen with dish washer, washing machine, micro waves, fridge and freezer.
Cosy, trendy apartment where you can really relax and feel at home in a quiet neighborhood. You can either enjoy the beautiful balcony, walk down to the beach (10m away) or explore downtown Porto with vibrant bars, restaurants, concerts, performances, etc..

Guest access
Supermarket, bars, restaurants only 15 minutes walk. If you come with your car, there is a free parking place in private con

Bohemian villa at the heart of Matosinhos, 10min walk to the beach. Encapsulated history with modern elements. 5 Bedrooms, 3 Bathrooms, large open kitchen and living room area, front and back garden and 3,65m tall ceilings. Urban yet very private.

The downstairs has the living room, kitchen and gardens whereas the upstairs has all the bedrooms. On the first floor 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and in the attic one bedroom and open plan bathroom.

Public transportation is all around, buses, metro, e-scooters

The space
Ribeira Cinema Apartments are the newest completely remodeled serviced apartments in Ribeira, with an astonishing first row river view. Located on the beginning of the Guindais Stairways, one of the most picturesque areas on the historical center that stays along the XIV century city wall, facing Ribeira, the Douro River, D. Luis bridge, the Port Wine Cellars and â€œSerra do Pilarâ€ Monastery.
The apartments are decorated with the Cinema theme and have all the commodities needed for a memorable stay.

The apartments are decorated with the Cinema theme and you
neighborhood_overview: Located right on the river first row facing D. Luis I bridge, in the most pictoresque nieghborhood, you will be in the heart of historical Porto area of Ribeira.
host_about:
Rivoli Cinema Hostel is the first Cinema themed Hostel in Portugal, and here you can find 13 rooms each one about a different film.You can choose a room by a Director or by a Film, and the interior of the room is decorated with things about the film. You can find movies from Tim Burton, Tarantino, Ridley Scott, Almodovar, Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Godard, Manoel de Oliveira, David Fincher, Alejandro GonzÃ¡lez IÃ±Ã¡rritu, Michael Radford, Mira Nair, Steven Spielberg, Stanley Kubrick, Jonathan Demme, Ang Lee._x000D_
_x000D_
The Rivoli Cinema Hostel has 12 rooms available (twin or double beds and 4 beds room), 6 shared toilets and 6 shared showers, a fully equipped kitchen, 1 lounge area where you can relax, have a drink, read books and play games, and an outside 180 m2 space where you can listen to music, barbecue, sunbath, party, or just chat with the others guests._x000D_
_x000D_
In the Hostel you can use free WiFi internet, and you have free maps, tourist info and guides._x000D_
Rivoli Cinema Hostel is located in the Porto historical center, right at the most important city square:  Avenida dos Aliados- where you can find streets full of monuments, restaurants, cafes, esplanades, shops, supermarkets, shoppings, tourism info spots . RCH is right in center of the cultural center of Porto near Coliseu, Cinemas, Theaters, and Art Galleries._x000D_
_x000D_
At the doorstep you can find metro, bus, sightseeing bus, train, taxis and tram.From here you can easily visit the most important references in the city like the Port Wine Cellars, Clerigos Tower, Serralves Museum and its beautiful gardens, go to a concert in Casa da Musica, take a walk across the bridges, take a look at a local architecture, visit the F. C. Porto stadium, travel by boat in Douro river where you can take great pictures and have a drink in one of the many bars in Ribeira._x000D_
_x000D_
Nightlife is around the hostel, you just have to choose between cafes, nightclubs, discos or bars where you can meet Erasmus students and locals. Right across the street you have the Rivoli Theater where you can see musicals and at February you can attend one of the best Fantastic Cinema Festival in the world â€“ Fantasporto.

name: Rental unit in Porto Â· â˜…4.61 Â· Studio Â· 1 bed Â· 1 bath
description:
Located in the heart of Porto and facing the Douro River, this is the best lodging for families/friends who wish to explore Porto!

The space
Welcome to my home!

Set in a refurbished 19th-century building and tastefully furnished with modern decors, this charming home is close to many of Porto's top attractions!

Fitted with a sofabed, a comfy double bed and a TV, unwind in the living room after a busy day of exploring Porto. There's also a work desk available and a drawer for all your belongings! The flat also comes with multiple windows throughout the space, allowing you to enjoy the sunlight and city views from the comfort of your home!

Upon arrival, complimentary hotel-quality linens will be provided to ensure you'll have a pleasant sleep.

The bathroom has all the amenities you'll need to freshen up including a shower, a toilet, and a sink. Fresh towels and free toiletries will also be supplied for your conven
neighborhood_overview:
Once a former home to Jewish and Armenian communities, its colorful old houses, cobbled streets, and location near the river will charm anyone who visits Miragaia. This area is also known for being particularly lively during SÃ£o JoÃ£o, the traditional street party that takes place in Porto in June.

Moreover, Miragaia is where you can eat sardines and drink the best of Portuguese wine as you watch the sunset over the river. Donâ€™t forget to take a walk alongside the Douro. You will not miss the Ponte LuÃ­s I, a spectacular metal arch bridge that spans the river between Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia.

You will see that the Bolsa Palace dominates the Infante D. Henrique Square. Visit the famous Arab room inspired by the Alhambra of Grenada in Spain. Igreja de San Francisco is must visit if you want to be refresh!

After, you can either hop on the Funicular dos Guindais or stroll along Bandeirinha da SaÃºde (Miradouro) to get a better view of the Douro river
host_about:
Hi there!

We're GuestReady, a professional property management company helping hosts around the world deliver outstanding experiences to their guests.

We welcome all guests, clean and prepare our homes for your arrival and will be available 24/7, should you have any questions or requests. From the second you book with us to the moment you check-out, weâ€™re here to make sure you have a smooth and comfortable stay!

With our years of experience in the hospitality business, you can be assured of a fantastic stay at any of GuestReady's properties. We manage multiple properties around town, so if you're looking for something specific, do let us know and we'd be happy to help you find the perfect place just for you.
We're looking forward to meeting you and are always ready to answer any of your questions!

Warm regards,
GuestReady Team

name: Home in Porto Â· â˜…4.93 Â· 1 bedroom Â· 1 bed Â· 1 private bath
description:
Studio fully equipped for resting, having fun, soft meals and, with a beautiful garden.
We love to receive people but, respecting their space and privacy.
Can park the car at front door, bus stop on the corner and subway stations 10 min. walking.

The space
We envision "White Basement with Green Garden" (WBwGG) as a "waiting room " of the city of Porto, yes, because the city has so much to see and to live that, we don't want our visitors stuck in the house so, between each city tour, here will be the perfect refuge to rest and, why not, have fun with comfort and privacy.
If arriving by car, can park at the front door for free.
Once installed, you can reach downtown by bus, subway or, even walking for 20 minutes; the bus stop is around the corner and, any of the four subway stations are 10 minutes away.
Guests can walk away and return when and, as often as they want.
While in the house enjoy; read your own book or, pick one from our bo
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the oriental area of the town but, Porto is not very wide and has good transportations so, everything is not far away.
Our neighborhood don't have much to offer regarding leisure but, for futebol lovers F. C. Porto stadium is around the corner, and you can't miss a visit to F. C. Porto museum! It's the perfect refuge after an hip-hop in the city, which is right there, and when you return you can try yoga lessons at the school just next to our house.
Relaxing comfortably installed in our garden, will be like staying in the countryside.
host_about:
My main hobby is searching; I search about everything related to life-style, design, arquitecture, decoration, fashion, restaurants, shops, cool places in general and, I confess, gossip!_x000D_
Poker was a mix of hobby and profession, it came to me by fun, playing online but, started to met people in the real world, and_x000D_
writing for magazines and websites. During 8 years I had an weekly column in J magazine, what ended with an invitation to cooperate with BetClick for the Poker section in their Portuguese branch office. _x000D_
To handle my Poker consulting business, I founded "Coisas do Poker" ("Things about Poker). _x000D_
But, my real passion is interior design and receive people._x000D_
Until now, I only practiced in in-house projects, for personal needs, in the different appartments where I lived._x000D_
For eight years, I lived in Luxembourg, where I worked in the headquarters of the European Community Parliament, revising texts for the Portuguese publications._x000D_
After a short return to Portugal, I went to Brazil for one year, this time, just for fun, where I lived in Araras and Rio de Janeiro._x000D_
Now I've embraced, somehow, professional projects in these areas, like this WBwGG" (White Basement with Green Garden", the "Caramba!" and the "WHwTG" (White House with Tasca Gourmet)._x000D_
The "Caramba!" is an, already running, project with my friend Marina where we convert old fashioned furniture, and objects, into cool stuff._x000D_
Most of my parent's furniture will be the guinea pig and, once transformed, will be exposed in hot spots in the city but, also, in the house, where guests can see and even use._x000D_
The "WHwTG" is on his half way to launch, it's also a guest house but in the countryside, in PÃ³voa da RaÃ­nha, a very small place on the way to Serra da Estrela._x000D_
This is my grandparent's house, a typical old stone house of the Portuguese countryside, which I've adapted to be comfortable but keeping the original trace._x000D_
The purpose here is, not only, receive guests but, also, open the "tasca gourmet" to serve, and sell, regional food and beverage and promote tasting events._x000D_
With luck, the project in PÃ³voa da RaÃ­nha can be extended for the family lands that will face the water mirror of the future Girabolhos dam, under construction and, expected to be finished in one, or two years._x000D_
_x000D_
Here is a little of myself, what I've been doing and future projects but, here, may main goal is to have the chance to receive, the best possible, everyone who decides to visit us; that will be an enormous pleasure!_x000D_

neighborhood_overview:
Full of objects of interest, the Historic Centre of Vila Nova de Gaia today offers a mixture of sensations that vary between the splendour of its historic monuments and the modernity of its public spaces.

There are many monuments to enjoy, including the Monastery of the Serra do Pilar, the Luiz I bridge, the Port cellars, the church of Santa Marinha and the monastery of Corpus Christi as well as many excellent and modern public spaces, such as those along the riverfront, alongside which can be seen the barcos rabelos, the embarkation point for cruises along the river, and the Cais de Gaia (Gaia Quay), a special place where restaurants, bars, shops and performance areas are clustered together, offering the visitor a panoply of entertainment and interest.

name: Home in Vila Nova de Gaia Â· â˜…4.82 Â· 3 bedrooms Â· 3 beds Â· 4 baths
description:
The space
Detached villa with sea and river situated in Vila Nova de Gaia. Really next to Oporto City and very close to many beautifull beaches with BLUE FLAG quality.
The house is really next to the mouth of Douro river, with an amazing view, and nearby of Porto wine cellars and next to the typical fishing village of Afurada.

The house has 4 floors, an attic with terrace and a basement with direct garden access.
There are 3 bedrooms ( 1 single bed suite ; 1 double bedroom ; 1 child bedroom ) 1 living room with fireplace, TV & DVD player. 1 Completely equipped kitchen.
All linen and towels are provided and with request we can provide one more single bed.
There is a 18km boardwalk with a cycle track and a pedestrian promenade along the seaside.
You can enjoy the sea and river breeze by using the cycle track or the pedestrian promenade for enjoying breathtaking view of "Ribeira", considered world heritage of humanity by UNESCO.

host_about:
Mother and Son in Porto, Portugal - improving the art of hospitality

Welcome to our self-catered apartments!
 
Located on the historical center of Oporto, in the heart of a UNESCO World Heritage Center, you'll find a building that belongs to our family for four generations.
 
After my mother (Lu'is grandmother) passed away in 2010 I inherited this building and found a really degraded space with a lot of structural problems and fierce tenants.
 
Having one apartment vacant me and my sons decided to refurbish the entire apartment and prepare it with all the needed amenities for a modern and cozy experience.
 
And we decided to rent it for tourists.
 
The first of our apartments came to daylight in May 2012. Our yellow apartment.
 
The experience was so overwhelming with massive bookings and great reviews that we decided to "tackle" the rest of the building.
 
And so we did.
 
In October 2012 the building went to major refurbishment works with all the structural, electricity, plumbing and communications being changed.
 
We repaired all the commons spaces, painted all the walls and ceilings, changed the windows, repaired and changed the floors, changed all the bathrooms and kitchens while maintaining at the same time all the qualities that give this building itâ€™s finesse.
 
There wasn't a single square inch that we didn't touch!
  
The rest of the apartments came to the market in June 2013 and the bookings went sky high!
 
Right now we have 9 apartments: Blue (6 pax), Yellow (4 pax), Green (2 pax), Pink (2), Brown (2), Orange (2), White (2) , Grey (2) and Red (2)

Again all the critics are excellent with major emphasis on the quality of the apartments and the warm welcomes that both I and my son LuÃ­s provide.
 
This is a family business made with love and with respect for the guests that come here.
 
We want you to feel at home in a foreign place and we like to consider you as more than guests.
 
You are our friends that come to visit our beautiful city.
 
Be prepared to a personalized check in, with our mostly enjoyed briefing on sightseeing, Oporto History and local tips!
 
So, enjoy our apartments!
 
EugÃ©nia, October 2019

host_about:
My name is Afonso and I'm 28 years old. I've been an Airbnb host for 2 years now and I love it!_x000D_
_x000D_
I've lived in Porto for most of my life and every day this city continues to amaze me. In the last couple of years Porto has been growing radically, specially when it comes to tourism, and it has been a pleasure to be part of it. Fortunately, this growth didn't affect the city's truly unique charm. It only turned it more dynamic!_x000D_
_x000D_
I'm really passionate about traveling and I've already visited more than 30 countries (and counting). But when I am not traveling what I really enjoy is welcoming people from around the world. _x000D_
_x000D_
I really appreciate getting feedback from all guests. This will help me continue to improve my hosting skills._x000D_
_x000D_
Hope you enjoy Porto. See you soon!_x000D_

description:
Quinta do Moinho is the ideal place to finish reading that book you want, to cook a delicious meal, or just relax listening to the water stream. The big garden offers various idyllic spots, underneath a rose arch, at the river shore or at the fire-pit. Privacy guaranteed since closest neighbors live 300 meters away.
Explore the archaeological, natural and historical sites around Campo-Valongo. The city of Porto is just 12 km away. Francisco SÃ¡ Carneiro international airport is just 18 km.

The space
The property is located in Campo next Rio Ferreira, a river that flows into the Douro river. Quinta do Moinho consists of the main house (living room and kitchenette, bath and bedroom) and a garden. In addition to a king size double bed in the bedroom in the main house, there is also a fold out couch in the living room.
If you never slept listening to the sound of the river, this is your chance. The kitchen is fully equipped (coffee grinder, juicer and pans,
neighborhood_overview:
The watermill house is located at the end of a working class neighborhood, but at the beginning of a nature reserve, part of "Serras do Porto" (Porto Mountains) with hiking and running trails, and a Paleozoic Park of archaeological and historical note. Opposite to the watermill-house there is an active slate mine you can walk by. There are great mountain and river views, all around you.
You will love "Quinta do Moinho" because of the views, the location, the outdoors space, and the ambiance. It is suitable for couples, solo adventurers, families (with kids), and furry friends (pets).
host_about:
Greetings,_x000D_
Ten years ago when I found "Quinta do Moinho" I was the happiest person on earth. In the past years I have tried, (with some help from my friends), to turn it into a comfortable, cozy and relaxing place. In the garden and surroundings one can hear the birds and the water stream, (and life is slow again). _x000D_
I am happy to share this place with you.

Porto City Hosts is a locally based tourism team consisting of proud Porto citizens.

There are walks by the sea, boat cruises on the UNESCO World Heritage Douro river walk through the old Porto streets.

This apartment is situated in a very calm area and despite the relaxing atmosphere inside the apartment you are very close to the modern city centre and the old historical town.

My husband Hugo is my co-host and we're both very happy to welcome you in this wonderful city!

neighborhood_overview:
Madalena is an urban village in the municipality of Vila Nova de Gaia, which is 6 Km from the historic center of Oporto, classified as a World Heritage since 1996.
Casa da Madalena is 600 meters from the train station, from which you can reach the historic center or travel along the coast.
Also lies 3 km from the beach where you can walk or ride the coast toward the north, to reach the mouth of the Douro river and visit the picturesque village of Afurada.
Toward the south at a distance of about 20 Km, you can visit some fishing villages as Aguda or Espinho where there are many restaurants where you can enjoy fresh seafood or have fun at EspinhoÂ´s Casino.
At Vila Nova de Gaia among other interesting places you can visit Port Wine cellars and enjoy the river border with many typical restaurants with a beautiful view of Oporto.

host_about:
Porto City Hosts is a locally based tourism team consisting of proud Porto citizens. 
We receive our guests with local charm and professional quality. We make our guests feel well accompanied during their stay, helping them to enjoy unforgettable tourist experiences with the confidence of having a team focused on their well being!
We also are passionate travelers eager to find out new places, to know new cultures, landscapes, palates, and smells. We like to introduce our city of Porto, sharing suggestions with new sensations, lived in the first person.
There are walks by the sea, boat cruises on the UNESCO World Heritage Douro river walk through the old Porto streets. 
You can listen to orchestras at the House of Music, smell the books at the Lello bookstore, where the Harry Potter writer was inspired, visit the cellars and drink Port wine, eat Francesinha, tripas Ã  moda do Porto, bacalhau or visit the farms where the grapes are harvested to produce the idyllic Porto!
It will be a pleasure to host you.

neighborhood_overview: The location is very special. It is very close to the outlet of Douro River, on the Gaia side (opposite to Porto city). It is on the 3rd floor so you do see water - river and ocean - from the windows. Sea and river ar at an equal - 15 min - walking distance. The closest site on the river is a nature reserve with bird observatories. From there a few extra steps to the left: you are in front of the ocean. A few steps to the right on the other hand take you to lovely fisherman's village Afurada with fantastic views of Porto and the Douro river upstream. And Porto being a very dense city, you are actually 10 min away from its city center by car!

neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located in Rua dos Caldeireiros, which is one of those very typical streets of the Historic Centre of Porto that is worth knowing. It goes from Rua de SÃ£o Bento da VitÃ³ria, near Torre dos ClÃ©rigos to Rua das Flores.

It is an alley to walk slowly and observe all those buildings glued to each other, their balconies, the clothes drying and the new commerce that begins to appear.
Rua dos Caldeireiros is a street of many traditions, history and work.

Formerly Rua da Ferraria de Cima, which only in 1780 was renamed Rua dos Caldeireiros, it received this name because it was there that a great number of blacksmith's workshops were concentrated. Where iron was melted for the most diverse arts, among them, wood ovens, braziers and boilers.

Years have passed, the blacksmiths are no longer there, and many things have changed, but the street has been gaining a new life and the strength of the work still continues in Rua dos Caldeireiros!

name: Rental unit in Vila Nova de Gaia Â· â˜…4.47 Â· 3 bedrooms Â· 4 beds Â· 2.5 baths
description:
An exceptionally well designed apartment at a beautiful location. Huge and lively kitchen, a big sunny living room with a balcony sheltered from the wind. Az a bonus an amazing castle view from all 3 rear windows. The outlet of Douro River within walking distance. Ocean and nature view from all the windows.
Recent improvements make it also finally well adapted for bigger groups!

The space
The location is very special. It is very close to the outlet of Douro River, on the Gaia side (opposite to Porto city). It is on a small hill so you do see water - river or ocean - from every window. A 10 min walk takes you to a nature reserve with bird observatories. From there a few extra steps to the left: you are in front of the ocean. A few steps to the right on the other hand take you to lovely fisherman's village Afurada with fantastic views of Porto and the Douro river upstream. And Porto being a very dense city, you are actually 10 min away from its city centre by
neighborhood_overview:
It is a mixture of city and countryside. Thanks to the building's position (in a cul-de-sac) there is no traffic at all and all you see is fields around you. But make 100m and you are on the main streets, with public transportation.
As you go further the more exciting locations are naturally related to the water - ocean or river. Fisherman village Afurada, especially since its new Marina has been achieved, is an exciting clash of very old village culture and chic and modern. The seashore, where special efforts have been taken in order to preserve the dunes, has countless restaurants and bars. These beaches are definitely surfer beaches! And there is a golf in Miramar, some 5km further south.
host_about: I am a symphony orchestra musician, living in Porto since 2000 and working at Rem Koolhas' smashing palace Casa da Musica. Porto is a very special and unique city that you can enjoy in lots of different ways as a tourist. But as for living there, I wouldn't swap home with anyone!

neighborhood_overview:
SÃ£o Pedro da Afurada is a village on the left bank of the Douro, just next to the river mouth. It is the most recent, smallest and most typical of Gaia's parishes.
Afurada is essentially known for its fishing traditions as well as for its feast in honour of SÃ£o Pedro which is commemorated every year on the first weekend of July and consists of a beautiful pilgrimage followed by a lively open-air festival.
The gastronomy of this parish has a special glow because many of the fish dishes that you can appreciate in its restaurants are fruit of the local work.

name: Loft in Porto Â· â˜…4.96 Â· Studio Â· 1 bed Â· 1 bath
description:
The fusion of traditional and contemporary architecture. Suspended bed and terrace

The space
In a full restored building, Porto Penthouse has an excellent terrace with sweeping views over green gardens of Priorado Square (Largo do Priorado) and the oldest church in Porto - Church of Cedofeita, giving a feeling of great openness, not usual in the urban Porto tissue, mostly defined by narrow streets. The terrace is equipped with garden furniture suitable for dining and enjoying moments of relaxation and outdoor recreation. Inside the paradox between the traditional and the contemporary is revealed. In this open space stands a suspended bed, the center piece for a new experience. The bathroom is lined with innovative building materials generating unusual environmental atmospheres. It is equipped with facilities like LCD 32", Cable TV, high performance air conditioning, combi oven, induction hob, wireless internet and small appliances (no washing machine).
neighborhood_overview: The choice of this location obeyed three main requirements.  We wanted an area conducive to rest, without being in the nocturnal hustle of the historic centre, but well within the urban centre.  Have nice views, without buildings blocking views, as in most of the typical narrow streets of Porto.  Great for quick and convenient travel, next to a metro station with a direct line to the airport and trains.  This place is located on the edge of the historic center, where all the main tourist attractions are reachable on foot (from 15 to 30 minutes).  That's how we chose this place to rehabilitate an old building next to the national monument where the first church in the city of Porto was built.
host_about: We are a middle-aged couple who loves to travel, discover new cultures, architecture and good food :)

The apartment is located in an iconic building 2 minutes walk from the famous Ribeira with its restaurants, bars and boat trips, 2 minutes from the cathedral, and 5 minutes from SÃ£o Bento station.
It is perfectly placed to visit the world heritage site of Porto city centre. Go down to the Ribeira to watch the world go by in a riverside cafe, or to take a river trip up the Douro to see the Port wine vineyards. Walk across the river to sample wines in the port wine lodges in Gaia. Visit the Cathedral, the ClÃ©rigos Tower and the colourful BolhÃ£o market. Visit the Serralves Museum, one of the best art galleries in Europe, and the Casa da MÃºsica, an incredible work of contemporary architecture. neighborhood_overview:
Porto is the second-largest city in Portugal, after Lisbon.
Located along the Douro river estuary in northern Portugal, Porto is one of the oldest European centres, and registered as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1996. Its settlement dates back many centuries, when it was an outpost of the Roman Empire. Its Latin name, Portus Cale, has been referred to as the origin for the name "Portugal", based on transliteration and oral evolution from Latin.

One of Portugal's internationally famous exports, port wine, is named for Porto, since the metropolitan area, and in particular the adegas of Vila Nova de Gaia, were responsible for the production and export of the fortified wine.The Porto region is also a major producer of cork.
host_about:
We are Feels Like Home Holiday Rentals.
A company that was born with a unique purpose: to bring you the best living experience during your trip to Portugal.
Thatâ€™s right we want you to feel like home! We offer beautifully furnished, well-located apartments and houses for your holiday or business stay. We're ideal for travelers who enjoy sleeping in comfortable homes at comfortable prices!
We offer you options!
Choose from over 500 carefully selected properties in Portugal, suited for every taste and every occasion. From studios to rustic country homes to sleek city duplexes, whether itÂ´s in Algarve, Ericeira, Lisbon, Madeira, Porto, or somewhere in between, we have a property that's right for you!

neighborhood_overview:
In line with what is happening in the Portuguese northwest, also in the municipality of PÃ³voa de Varzim religious festivals are the main manifestation of the collective communities. Spreading throughout the year, however, a clear concentration in the months of June, July and August. Each of the parishes of the county has a favorite devotion. Although every celebration has its own characteristics, it does not nullify the religious and cultural unity of substance.
Of all religious festivals stand out Holy Week; S. Peter, big party in town, with the highlight on the night of June 29 to 28; Our Lady of the Assumption, patron saint of fishermen, the 15th of August; and the Lady of Sorrows, September. Deserves particular emphasis because of their size, the cult of Sister Alexandrina recently beatified, and that makes the parish Balasar an important pilgrimage site for domestic and foreign.

name: Home in Porto Â· â˜…4.87 Â· 2 bedrooms Â· 3 beds Â· 1.5 baths
description:
A charming house with view both on the Douro river and the sea.

The space
The house offers an exceptional view over the Douro river and the sea.
It is a two floor dwelling house with 120m2 and a garden (80m2).
On the ground floor, there is a living room, a toilet, a dining area and a fully equipped kitchen, with garden access.
Upstairs, there are two bedrooms: 1 bedroom, facing west, with a double bed and a small terrace offering panoramic view over the mouth of the Douro; The other room, facing east, has two single beds and a small balcony. A complete bathroom serves both rooms.
The house is located in a quiet street where you can easily leave your car.
and public transport in a close neighborhood (metro, bus, taxi).

Guest access
- Private garden with garden furniture and barbecue
- Double bedroom (matrimonial bed) with small terrace facing Douro river and sea.
- Twin bedroom (two single beds)
-
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in a traditional neighborhood that preserves several rural characteristics. However, it is very close to the city center.
Located on the slopes of the Douro, between the city center and the sea, this is a
quiet and peaceful neighborhood. It is in close proximity with all amenities, including local shops (grocery / bakery) and the bus stop is on the street next to the door. It is also at 10 min walk to the district of "Boavista" where you can find major retail and leisure areas (shops, restaurants, bars, cinemas, museums, etc), served by a large network of public transport (bus, metro, electric, taxi).

It has an easy access to different points of historic and cultural interest, within a 10 min walk to the House of Music and 20 min to the Serralves Museum) and other leisure areas (parks - Park City with organic market on Saturday, botanical garden, beaches and surf spots, cycling lanes, etc.).
It is an ideal place for those looking to stay
host_about:
Hello, I'm Ester, live and work in Porto. _x000D_
I love the city for its historical and cultural heritage and also by its surrounding landscape - river, sea and green spaces that make this city is so pleasant to live. _x000D_
People are part of the well-being of this city, being available and given, always with a friendly smile. _x000D_
_x000D_
The architecture and landscaping surrounding, the events, gastronomies, and above all the friendliness of the people make this city a travel destination, charming and special. _x000D_
_x000D_
I will gladly give you some tips for you to discover all the charms of this town._x000D_

The flat comfortably accommodates 6 people and itâ€™s your perfect home away. Whether you are a family with children or a group of friends looking for a home away, this is a place youâ€™ll be looking forward to come back to after a day out in the town.
With 125 square meters, the flat occupies the entire 3rd floor of t
neighborhood_overview:
Overlooking the Douro River, Porto is one of the most ancient European cities. It was born and developed from the northern bank of this river during the Middle Ages. One of the most significant aspects of Porto and its historical centre is its landscape, combining harmony with the urban structure and presenting a frame of rare beauty. The city was classified as World Heritage by UNESCO in 1996.

When discovering Porto, you will find many surprises. Besides its welcoming and historical environment, Porto is also contemporary and artistic. This is shown not only in the streets, architecture, monuments and museums but also in the terraces, restaurants, nightlife and shopping areas.

We look forward to welcoming you!
Filomena and Ana

description:
We are a campervan rental service located in the North of Portugal. With our vans, travelers explore at their own pace, with the freedom of having no ties and the assurance of a great service. Our mission is to provide the adventure of a lifetime!

WeÂ´re based in Porto, which is well served with flights (many of them low cost) from major European destinations. It offers a great starting point to explore the country, and specially the North. You can also travel through Europe (unlimited miles).

The space
This is a practical and economical solution for your adventure holidays. It allows you to travel independently, with privacy and without pre-defined travelling packs. Whether you want to visit the countryside, the mountains, the city or the beach, itÂ´s your choice.

Our campervans are Ford Transits with economical Diesel engines and, in paid highways, they will pay smaller fees than a regular auto-caravan.

The same vehicle that works
neighborhood_overview:
Experience the feeling of living in a house on wheels and visit Portugal from top to bottom. Stop wherever you want to, whenever you want, make your meals and sleep when and where you feel like. The choice is always yours! You can have your breakfast by the sea, wake up in the middle of the mountains, have dinner outside with a view over the city, and fall asleep under the starry sky. The choice is yours! You can be in contact with nature, in the company of friends, family and your pets. It is simple and uncomplicated. You donâ€™t have to book hotels, there are no arrival schedules to limit you, no prepaid programs to follow. It is about total freedom of choice and use.
Start your journey and discover and enjoy the unique adventure that is Portugal!
host_about:
I've been a camper from the age of 6! I used to go camping with my parents on a scooter. Every summer, me and my family used to go travelling through Europe on a caravan. Recently I upgraded to a campervan as it is a more sustainable option and is easier to drive and park. I love the freedom it provides for a touring holiday or escaping into Nature and my mission is to share this experience with fellow travellers. _x000D_
_x000D_
Our campervans provide freedom on wheels. So guests can travel with no restrictions and no ties. With no need to book hotels, no arrival schedules to limit you, no pre-paid programs to follow. It is about total freedom of choice and use to explore or relax._x000D_
_x000D_
You can get closer to Nature. Fall asleep under the starry sky, wake up in the middle of the mountains, have breakfast by the sea. The perfect companion for outdoor activities surrounded by Nature. Pick up your gear and go explore!_x000D_
_x000D_
We are locals with a passion for travel and gastronomy keen on giving advice and proud of their travel library! We can suggest travel itineraries. We are specially keen on the North of Portugal region as its varied landscapes, heritage and people make it a fabulous destination that all travellers love!_x000D_
_x000D_
Looking forward to providing you with the adventure of a lifetime!_x000D_
_x000D_

host_about:
A Portuguese registered architect, from Porto, Portugal._x000D_
I love travelling around the world and I have lived in several places: Los Angeles, New York, Delft , Rotterdam, London, Montreal, among other short stays in many countries and cities. When I travel, I try to be a true local most of times, to get a grip of the dynamics of the place and the people that make that place._x000D_
I work in the fields of architecture and in theatre and the performing arts, devoting part of my time  to creative culinary arts. My five can't-live-without-things are: food, people, beauty, travel and art in-all-its-forms!_x000D_

neighborhood_overview:
Bonfim is a central area of the city of Porto, being halfway between the historic center and the Antas area, where the EstÃ¡dio do DragÃ£o, home of the football club F.C.Porto is located.
Despite having varied commerce and restaurants, it is characterized as a strongly residential area at more affordable prices than the tourist center. Here you can enjoy a beautiful stay, with greater flexibility, either by quick access to other areas of the city by public transport or on foot, or by the possibility of parking on the street without parking meters near the Soares dos Reis School.
host_about:
Proudly from Porto, love our city, our people, our history :) Love to welcome and share the best tips I know from 30 years living here.
Passionate about languages, fluent in Portuguese, English, Spanish, Italian and able to understand some French. Lived already in Milan, London and San Francisco.
Having had ocasionally hosted some groups in a family house in the Northern Portuguese countryside in the early days, hosting in Porto wasn't something completely new for me. I started hosting one apartment by the end of 2017 and now I manage more than 30 apartments in Porto! Thrilled for having made this my full-time job! You can count on me and my team 24h/7days available to help you.
Looking forward to meet you! Welcome to Porto!

neighborhood_overview: Cafe's, bars, restaurants, ATM's and small supermarkets are all within a two minute walk and there is even a lovely cafe downstairs on the ground floor of the building filling the stairwell with the delicious but dangerous smell of freshly baked cakes and pastries every morning! You've been warned! Food and cooking is one of my passions and I'll be delighted to recommend some fantastic places to eat in Porto whatever your budget or dietary requirements. For those who like to stay up late and experience Porto's thriving nightlife, the main bar and club area is conveniently located close, but not too close to the building making getting home after an evening of music and dancing easy and hassle free. Over the last few years Porto's social, cultural and culinary sides have gone through something of a renaissance and it seems like a new bar, club or restaurant opens up in the city centre almost every weekend! For this reason I'll save my own personal recommendations on where to eat, drink
host_about: Hello there! Thank you for stopping by :) I'm Martha and Porto is my hometown. I've travelled and lived in many different cities, but Porto is the only one I call home. I studied arts and film and recently become a mum. I love Portuguese cooking and cycling, you're welcome to ask for advice where to go and what to eat.
